intro: Erophila spathulata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a head. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry conditions. Erophila spathulata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in herbal medicine.
